name: DSIP
overview: A neuropeptide first isolated in the 1970s from rabbits in delta-wave sleep. Research has explored its effects on sleep regulation and stress response, though human clinical data remains limited.
who_should_avoid: severe sleep disorders without sleep specialist guidance
interactions_notes: Limited interaction data. May interact with sleep medications, sedatives, anxiolytics, and alcohol. May affect stress hormone regulation. Avoid driving or operating machinery after use.
dosing_ranges_literature: Research protocols have explored doses ranging from 1-5 mg administered before bedtime. Human clinical studies are limited and protocols vary significantly.
storage_notes: Store unreconstituted peptide in freezer (-20Â°C or colder). After reconstitution with bacteriostatic water, store refrigerated and use within 2-3 weeks.

references.title: DSIP and sleep regulation
references.note: Early research on DSIP isolation and sleep-inducing properties.

references.title: Sleep peptides: mechanisms and effects
references.note: Review of sleep-regulating peptides including DSIP.
